reviews.text:
Thank you Jim for your help and kindness after a long journey. You helped me get to the correct train and car, on July 10th at 11:30 a.m. from Gatwick to my destination.
Your warm welcome was a positive beginning
to my holiday. I hope you are valued at work.

Well organized terminal. Easy to find when you arrive the airport. Only a few meters away from arrival from you flight. Tickets is easy to purchase from the automat. Cash and cards is ok. WC available. Wheelchair friendly. Service desk. M&S food and WHSmith nearby. Train to London takes approximately 40 minutes. Express 30 min.

Just be aware if the trains aren't running due to staff on strike the information might not be on the information boards.It happened to me.I totally forgot it was a bank holiday and there would probably be problems.Id been away for 2weeks and didn't know and only guessed when the only train information was for London because all other trains were leaving from three bridges but i had to ask to find out.The guy who helped me was great.Shame the management weren't too bothered.

At Gatwick Airport. it is good that it is Step Free Access. But I Think There Should be a Brand New Direct Train service from Gatwick Airport to Enfield Town in the future. With a Brand New project. Not only that. I Think the London Freedom pass Should Expand to Gatwick Airport in the future. Also I Think There Should be a Brand New London Overground Service from Gatwick Airport to London Victoria in the future as well.
